summary: This is a Palm Beach Police Department incident report detailing the execution of a search warrant at 358 El Brillo Ave, Palm Beach, on October 20, 2005. The report describes the search of the residence, including vehicles, closets, bathrooms, bedrooms, and a pool cabana, and lists various items seized as evidence, such as massage tables, nude photographs, penis-shaped soap, and an adult sex toy. The report notes the presence of a person believed to be 'Mr. [Epstein]' during the search.

persons.name: Det.
persons.context: The reporting officer searched certain areas of the house with this detective as part of the search warrant execution.

persons.name: CSEU tech
persons.context: The officer accompanied this technician while she photographed the exterior of the house, and CSEU personnel later collected seized evidence.

persons.name: Mr. [Epstein]
persons.context: The officer was assigned to stand by with a person believed to be Mr. [Epstein], who was present in the residence during the warrant service and subsequent search.

connections.description: Both are law enforcement personnel involved in executing the same search warrant at the residence.
The detective was searching the residence of Mr. [Epstein] under a warrant, indicating an investigative relationship.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution at 358 El Brillo Ave
events.description: Palm Beach Police executed a search warrant at the residence, searching the garage, vehicles, closets, offices, bathrooms, bedrooms, and a pool cabana. Various items were seized as evidence, including massage tables, nude female photographs, penis-shaped soap, and an adult sex toy.

locations: The residence's garage, kitchen closets, office, foyer bathroom/closet, upstairs east-side bedrooms, and pool cabana in the south west corner of the property
keyFacts: A search warrant was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence (358 El Brillo Ave) on October 20, 2005.
Evidence seized included two massage tables, partial nude female photographs, penis and vagina-shaped soap, an adult sex toy, and a phone message book.
The report notes that a bathroom and shower area were not used as designed but for storage, containing a gun safe in the shower.
A person believed to be Mr. Epstein was present in the residence during the warrant service and search, and an officer was assigned to stand by with him.
The search covered multiple areas including three Mercedes Benz vehicles, a Harley Davidson motorcycle, and the pool cabana where several photographs of nude females were seized.
